abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Renewable Energy
            for Rural Economic Development Project for Sri Lanka are to
            improve the quality of rural life by utilizing off-grid
            renewable energy technologies to provide energy services to
            remote communities; and promote private sector power
            generation from renewable energy resources for the main
            grid. The project's development objectives have been
            achieved and the performance indicators have already
            exceeded its target values (e.g. the capacity of grid
            connected renewable energy installations have surpassed the
            135 megawatt (MW) cumulative target, while the reduction in
            carbon emissions has achieved 142 percent of the end project
            target.) There are no outstanding fiduciary issues and
            Financial Monitoring Reports are submitted on time with no
            overdue audit reports. Environmental and social safeguards
            compliance is also satisfactory. The reallocation is
            necessary to allow full utilization of remaining grant funds
            and meet the increasing demand for funding technical
            assistance activities by utilizing unspent amounts from
            other categories.
